thread.title: Thierry Henry on hand at New York Knicks game, can he hit a jumper?
thread.title_full: Thierry Henry on hand at New York Knicks game, can he hit a jumper?

author: ESPN staff
title: Thierry Henry on hand at New York Knicks game, can he hit a jumper?

organizations.name: new york red bull thierry henry

text:
about an hour ago Thierry Henry on hand at New York Knicks game, can he hit a jumper? 
Arsenal legend and former New York Red Bull Thierry Henry was on this side of the pond on Friday night and he decided to take in a New York Knicks game at Madison Square Garden while back in the Big Apple. 
Henry, who played four seasons and scored 51 goals for the Red Bulls, is now a pundit and assistant manager with Belgium after calling time on an illustrious career that included Premier League, La Liga and Ligue 1 titles to go with a World Cup win with France in 1998. 
Shown below speaking with countryman Joakim Noah, whose father Yannick was a tennis pro, Henry seemed at ease courtside ahead of the Knicks game against the Charlotte Hornets. A photo posted by New York Knicks �� (@nyknicks) on Jan 27, 2017 at 3:47pm PST 
Henry's goalscoring prowess was well-documented throughout his career, but Knick fans might be wondering if the 39-year-old can hit a jumpshot. New York are losers of 15 of their last 20 games and are outside of the playoff picture in the Eastern Conference. 
So what do you think Thierry? The Knicks could use a hand if you want to lace up the high tops and bring some of that magic back to the hardwood. 
Follow @ESPNFC on Twitter to keep up with the latest football updates.
